javadoc:
An implementation of a CodeBlockModel will produce CodeBlocks
 based on some algorithm.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the model name.
@return the model name
methods.name: getName
getCodeBlockAt
methods.comment: Get the code block with a starting address (i.e., entry-point) of addr.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor which allows user to cancel operation.

throws.comment: if the monitor cancels the operation.

return.comment: null if there is no codeblock starting at the address.

methods.name: getFirstCodeBlockContaining
methods.comment: Get the first code block that contains the given address.

params.name: addr
params.comment: address to find a containing block.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor which allows user to cancel operation.

throws.comment: if the monitor cancels the operation.

return.comment: a block that contains the address, or null otherwise.

methods.name: getCodeBlocksContaining
methods.comment: Get all the code blocks containing the address.

params.name: addr
params.comment: address to find a containing block.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor which allows user to cancel operation.

throws.comment: if the monitor cancels the operation.

return.comment: an array of blocks that contains the address, null otherwise.

methods.name: getCodeBlocks
methods.comment: Get an iterator over the code blocks in the entire program.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor which allows user to cancel operation.

throws.comment: if the monitor cancels the operation.

methods.name: getCodeBlocksContaining
methods.comment: Get an iterator over code blocks which overlap the specified address set.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor which allows user to cancel operation.

throws.comment: if the monitor cancels the operation.

methods.name: getSources
methods.comment: Get an iterator over the source flows into the block.

params.name: block
params.comment: the block to get the destination flows for.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor which allows user to cancel operation.

throws.comment: if the monitor cancels the operation.

methods.name: getNumSources
methods.comment: Get the number of source flows into the block.

params.name: block
params.comment: the code blocks to get the destination flows for.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor which allows user to cancel operation.

throws.comment: if the monitor cancels the operation.

methods.name: getDestinations
methods.comment: Get an iterator over the destination flows out of the block.

params.name: block
params.comment: the block to get the destination flows for.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor which allows user to cancel operation.

throws.comment: if the monitor cancels the operation.

methods.name: getNumDestinations
methods.comment: Get the number of destination flows out of the block.

params.name: block
params.comment: the code blocks to get the destination flows for.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor which allows user to cancel operation.

throws.comment: if the monitor cancels the operation.

methods.javadoc: Get the basic block model used by this model.
methods.name: getBasicBlockModel
methods.comment: Get the basic block model used by this model.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if externals are handled by the model,
 false if externals are ignored.  When handled, externals
 are represented by an ExtCodeBlockImpl.
methods.name: externalsIncluded
methods.comment:
Returns true if externals are handled by the model,
 false if externals are ignored.  When handled, externals
 are represented by an ExtCodeBlockImpl.

methods.javadoc:
Return in general how things flow out of this node.
 If there are any abnormal ways to flow out of this node,
 (ie: jump, call, etc...) then the flow type of the node
 takes on that type.
 If there are multiple unique ways out of the node, then we
 should return FlowType.UNKNOWN (or FlowType.MULTIFLOW ?).
 Fallthrough is returned if that is the only way out.
@return flow type of this node
methods.name: getFlowType
methods.comment:
Return in general how things flow out of this node.
 If there are any abnormal ways to flow out of this node,
 (ie: jump, call, etc...) then the flow type of the node
 takes on that type.
 If there are multiple unique ways out of the node, then we
 should return FlowType.UNKNOWN (or FlowType.MULTIFLOW ?).
 Fallthrough is returned if that is the only way out.

methods.name: getName
methods.comment: Get a name for this block.

return.comment:
usually the label at the start address of the block
    however the model can choose any name it wants for its blocks.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the program object associated with this CodeBlockModel instance.
@return program associated with this CodeBlockModel.
methods.name: getProgram
methods.comment: Returns the program object associated with this CodeBlockModel instance.

methods.javadoc:
Return true if this model allows overlapping of address sets for
 the blocks it returns.
@return true if this model allows overlapping of address sets for
         the blocks it returns.
         This implies that getBlocksContaining() can return more than one block.
         false implies that getBlocksContaining() will return at most one block.
methods.name: allowsBlockOverlap
methods.comment:
Return true if this model allows overlapping of address sets for
 the blocks it returns.

return.comment:
true if this model allows overlapping of address sets for
         the blocks it returns.
         This implies that getBlocksContaining() can return more than one block.
         false implies that getBlocksContaining() will return at most one block.

name: CodeBlockModel
comment:
An implementation of a CodeBlockModel will produce CodeBlocks
 based on some algorithm.
